div.p: BOE Zoom Meeting for 4-20-2020 has been posted to the Website. Thank you.
Clymer continues to deliver instructional materials to our students!
Clymer Central School Closure Update - CCS will remain closed through Friday, May 15, 2020. Please visit the Clymer CSD website for more information.

An updated food delivery schedule has been posted to the Clymer CSD website. CCS families may still sign up if interested in receiving bagged meals for their children during this closure. Please visit the Clymer CSD website for more information.
Another AMAZING delievery! Look at what this team can do! Thank you CSD!

CCS NOTICE: On Thursday, April 16, 2020 Governor Andrew Cuomo announced that New York State schools and non-essential businesses will remain closed through May 15, 2020, saying the coronavirus pandemic still makes it unsafe to resume regular daily lives. We will continue our food deliveries to those families who have chosen to receive them throughout the school closing. Continue to check the school website for further updates.

hr.p: In accordance with the Coronavirus Health and Safety Guidelines the tennis courts are locked up and all sports fields and playgrounds are no longer accessible. This is implemented to prohibit any group activity. Signage has been posted in the affected areas as a public notice to the community. The walking trail is not affected as long as social distancing practices are followed.

em.strong: ***No one is allowed into the building during this time. Until further notice, only authorized personnel will be allowed to enter the building on designated days. Thank you! ***

hr.p: During this time of uncertainty, please know that we are thinking about all of our students and their accomplishments this year. We plan to celebrate their achievements in the best way possible. As we wait for more guidance from local and state officials on social distancing practices, we are continuing with our Academic Excellence, NHS Induction, Graduation ceremony plans and more! Please continue to check our website for updates.

p.br:
Thank you!
Mrs. Fadale, Secondary Principal

hr.p: Please click the following link to read a letter from our principals: QUARTER 3 GRADING UPDATE
Please see this important letter on Child Care for Essential Workers in Chautauqua County: Child Care Services for Essential Workers

a.strong: Necessary Worker Child Care Survey Link

hr.p: If you are interested in receiving bagged meals for your children during this closure, you may still sign up for food deliveries. Please complete the CCS Parent Survey for Emergency School Closure under the COVID 19 Information tab, or call the cafeteria office at 716-355-2014. Food deliveries for those that have responded will take place between 7:30 and 10:00am directly to your residence on those dates; please meet the bus when it arrives.
